reviews.review_msg: Dr. Coley is alright. Don't think he deserves the insanely high reviews that he has up here. I feel like you have to stick directly to what he wants, as he does not allow a lot of wiggle room for creative thinkers, or those who wish to push their essays further.
very interesting prof. highly recommend attending class. marking scheme for assignments and exams are hard!

Not only does he look like the dad from Calvin and Hobbes come to life, but he's so passionate and enthusiastic that you can't help but want to come to class. Easy marker, really helpful, cracks witty comments... what more could you want from an English prof?  You go, Glen Coco.

Taking 201 with Coley made me want to study medieval literature way more, and I am definitely taking classes with him again.  Easy marker, no essay on the exam, really interesting lecturer, awesome tutorial structure, and impecable attitude towards students. Really, I can't recommend him more! Take a class with him if you ever have the opportunity!

David is one of the best professors I have ever had the pleasure of being taught by. His lectures are engaging, and he is incredibly knowledgable about medieval lit. Beyond that he is very helpful and truly wants his students to succeed, and if you show initiative and a willingness to learn it will definitely pay off for you.

What professor doesn't make you write an essay on a final exam!?!?!? You guessed right! David the hero! HE wakes you up, let me say that again, HE wakes you up at a 9:30am lecture. Learned lots in this class! Though the course was pretty religion heavy, but David made it all bearable :D Go on SIS and take an ENGL course that says David Coley! NOW:D
Awesome professor. You can tell that he really loves what he does.

A truly compassionate guy with an interest in assorted media. Perhaps not as exciting as a medeival lit class should have been, but Joakim is willing to help. I agree with the comment that he is a bit "bumbling" :)Too much discussion;has a tendency to ask questions that are so painfully obvious that no response comes...to which he simply rephrases!

As others have said on here, she's the worst professor in the English Department. Would not recommend unless you have no other choice. As countless others have said, her lectures are unclear and she rambles on.
She's a good prof but I just really wish she spoke up. She's very soft spoken and thats what may lull you to sleep. Other than that, she is not a bad prof.

This teacher was horrible. Yes, she is a smart and nice woman...but she can't teach a class to save her life. She is disorganized and goes off base quite often. Do the readings in the text and you should be fine. Do not get her for your tutorial, it's completely pointless. The class structure falls apart often. Not recommended unless you need it.

Hussey is one of the most passionate medievalists I have ever had the privilege of learning from. Very nice human being. Hard marker - but willing to help you work through your writing demons... his tough marking was a wake up call and I owe a lot of my progress to him. Worth every penny!

Matt is absolutely hilarious. He can make medieval lit interesting and fun. You have to go to lectures, but who wouldn't want to? He'll crack you up at least once a class. Plus... girl or guy, you'll have a crush on him by then end of it. It wont be an easy A, but it'll be worth working for.

Hi is the most amazing and entertaining professor i have ever had! i loved going to lecture and listening to him talk! the material tends to be a little dry at times, but he definitely makes it interesting. awesome awesome awesome!
I really liked this class Its a lot easier than expected if you go to lecture you will get an A Matt makes this boring medieval crap kinda funny... but seriously though dont expect it to be riveting

Dr. Hussey is very caring and was able to make otherwise boring content into material that was super engaging! Although, the readings were extremely long and I disliked that in his recorded lectures that he would go about 20min overtime each week, but weekly discussions were extremely easy and barely time consuming

Online class because it was taken during COVID, Dr. Hussey is an extremely understanding prof and turned a very boring class into something interesting. I never thought I would like medieval literature, but he teaches it so smoothly. Definitely recommend him as a prof, although there is a lot of reading and weekly responses.
